body: Thanks for reporting this.  Let us know when you have more details; there's not much we can do with just the exception and the one line of backtrace.

This behaviour hasn't changed since `2.14`, well since some time in 2010 actually, so it sounds like this could be a `guard` or `spork` issue here. I trust you completely shut down `spork` and `guard` when upgrading?

Verified that spork was not running before starting guard. The other change I see between beta2 and rc1 is: https://github.com/sporkrb/spork-rails/issues/25 (probably unrelated).

This IOError is happening at the very end, after running the tests and reporting on the slowest examples.
